intro: Gomphrena perennis subf. boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian everlasting, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces dense clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of pink, red, and purple, which remain intact even after the plant has dried, giving it the common name "everlasting." Its foliage is typically gray-green with a fuzzy texture, and it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. It is often cultivated as a ornamental plant for its long-lasting blooms and drought tolerance.
